clinical_study.brief_title: Prophylactic Use of Antibiotics in Endoscopic Injection of Tissue Adhesive in Gastric Varices
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Prophylactic Use of Antibiotics in Endoscopic Injection of Tissue Adhesive in Gastric Varices: A Multicenter Randomized Controlled Trial

collaborator.agency: The Second People's Hospital of Lanzhou
Xinhua Hospital, Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine
The First Affiliated Hospital of Anhui Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of prophylactic use of antibiotics in endoscopic injection of tissue adhesive in gastric varices.

detailed_description.textblock: Gastroesophageal variceal bleeding is the most common and life-threatening condition in patients with portal hypertension, which are susceptibility to bacterial infection. However, the prophylaxis use of antibiotics remained uncertain and lack of high level evidences.This study is a randomized controlled trial. The purpose of the study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of prophylactic use of antibiotics in endoscopic injection of tissue adhesive in gastric varices.

primary_outcome.measure: The incidence of infection after endoscopic treatment
primary_outcome.description: Patients will receive body temperature, blood routine, inflammatory markers examination before and after endoscopic treatment

secondary_outcome.description: Patients will be followed up and receive an endoscopic examination after patients have been followed up for 2 months.
The investigators observe the mortality events during 2 months
All clinical events were defined as occurrence rebreeding, ascitic fluid infection, portal vein thrombosis, or death.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and the first day after endoscopic treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: inflammatory factors including IL-6, IL-8, TNF-a, IL-1beta，IL-2R, IL-10
secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and the first day after endoscopic treatment

arm_group.description: Prophylactic use of antibiotics during endoscopic treatment, cefotiam 2.0g intravenous
Routine endoscopic examination and treatment. Antibiotics are not used during endoscopic treatment
